job_title: Cash Manager / Collector of Public Monies
position_description_html:
Job Description

Duties


The Cash Manager / Collector of Public Monies is responsible for all banking and related activities for the ABS. The position is responsible for managing official bank accounts and for the monitoring of cash balances to ensure that the ABS has sufficient funds in its accounts to meet its day-to-day operations.

Responsibilities include:
• Cash manager role - treasury daily & monthly activities:
o Download Bank Statements
o Process rejected payments
o Maintain banking spreadsheet and daily cash position
o Process draw downs and batch payment files
o Process direct EFT transfers
o Process stopped cheques
• Collector of Public Monies
• Banking of cash receipts
• Preparation of monthly journals & reconciliations
• Monthly bank reconciliations
• Assisting with the preparation of the FBT return
• Customer & vendor creations

The Cash Manager / Collector of Public Monies is required to communicate effectively with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders to ensure that all banking obligations are met.

About Australian Bureau of Statistics

The Australian Bureau of Statistics ABS is Australia’s national statistical agency, providing trusted official statistics on a wide range of economic, social, population and environmental matters of importance to Australia.

The ABS also has an important leadership role, coordinating statistical activities and collaborating with official bodies in the collection, compilation, analysis and distribution of statistics, both in Australia and overseas.

The ABS operates in a dynamic and progressive environment and houses offices in Canberra, Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide, Perth, Hobart, Darwin and Geelong. We also have a number of field staff working across all parts of Australia. We encourage and value a diverse workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people with a disability are encouraged to apply.

To find out more visit our website at http://www.abs.gov.au.
